body.head.byline: By VIVIAN S. TOY; With Elsa Brenner, Suzanne Hamlin and Lisa Prevost

abstract.p: Sampling of housing on market in New York City metropolitan area: photos (M)

block.p: Union Square Area Duplex $595,000
MANHATTAN: 49 East 12th Street (between Broadway and University Place), #3D
A one-bedroom, one-bath co-op with a fireplace. Andrew Hinek, Prudential Douglas Elliman (212) 350-2299; www.elliman.com
MAINTENANCE: $651 a month
PROS: The kitchen and bathroom have been renovated with eye-catching details, including slate kitchen counters and cedar bathroom walls.
CONS: The bedroom, which is on the lower level, is quite small and doesn't get much light.
Prospect Park Co-op $569,000
BROOKLYN: 25 Plaza Street West (at Lincoln Place), #4
A one-bedroom, one-bath co-op in an Art Deco elevator building with doorman, parking garage and roof deck. Mary Goodson, Aguayo & Huebener (718) 757-6684; www.ahrlty.com.
Open house Sunday, 12:30 to 2:30 p.m.
MAINTENANCE: $728 a month
PROS: This sunny apartment, in an impeccably maintained building right off Grand Army Plaza, has a graceful foyer and a newly expanded and updated kitchen.
CONS: Although the apartment appears larger, the actual square footage is about 600.
Wilton Split Level $715,000
CONNECTICUT: 380 Olmstead Hill Road

A 1,769-square-foot nontraditional split level with three bedrooms, two baths, central air-conditioning and an attached one-car garage on just over an acre. Theresa Blinder, Barbara Jasinski, John Karlson, William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty (203) 762-2220; www.Realtors3.com
TAXES: $8,065 a year
PROS: Updated throughout, the interior has also been freshly painted in warm hues.
CONS: The washer-dryer hookups and access to the unfinished basement are in the garage.
Updated 1929 Tudor $699,995
WESTCHESTER: 47 Jane Street, Hartsdale
TAXES: $11,699 a year
A three-bedroom, two-and-a-half-bath stucco and wood-beamed house with two-car attached garage. Anne Bordoni, Coldwell Banker Residential Brokerage; (914) 723-3340; www.coldwellbankermoves.com
PROS: The house has a large family room/kitchen area with skylights and updated appliances.
CONS: The bathrooms could use updating, and the house does not have central air-conditioning.
Upper West Side Co-op $1,655,000
MANHATTAN: 255 West 90th Street (at Broadway), #2C
A three-bedroom, two-bath co-op with a full dining room in a part-time doorman building. William Barton, Halstead Property (212) 381-2215; www.halstead.com
MAINTENANCE: $1,337 a month

PROS: The rooms in this spacious apartment ooze prewar charm, with original details like pocket doors, moldings and beamed ceilings. The master bedroom has a decorative fireplace with tile and brass accents. The large kitchen has an original floor-to-ceiling cupboard, along with stone tiles and counters from a recent renovation.
CONS: Each bathroom can be reached only by going through a bedroom. The smaller bedrooms are a bit dark.
